data.text: @Gb2me1 @StuartDNeilson @DonnellyStephen @rtenews daily figures are on https://t.co/80viIy6n1q ,all  media has to do is look there, just the same as we can, not everyone knows this though, which is EXACTLY why the media should be reporting from this instead of waiting for a text from Stephen, who wonâ€™t EVER admit it anyway

@StuartDNeilson @DonnellyStephen @rtenews Our friends and family in those figures are no less important than those in NI. And no less important than those that died earlier in the pandemic. Show them the respect they deserve. @DonnellyStephen

@StuartDNeilson . @DonnellyStephen Why is your dept not releasing mortality figures to the media on a daily basis. @rtenews have told me your department doesn't give them the figures daily. Meanwhile the NI figures are reported in the news daily. Leading people to think there are no deaths here

@Gb2me1 @StuartDNeilson @RobOHanrahan @PaulQuinnNews @TodaywithClaire @VirginMediaNews @rtenews @RTE_PrimeTime @irishexaminer Why is nobody in media reporting this? By ignoring the pandemic all you are doing is letting everyone believe it is safe not to wear masks & thousands more will get infected, long covid, die @98FM @FM104 @Q102FeelGood
@MorgenrothEdgar @StuartDNeilson @ToniTaylor546 Loosen your tie.... it's cutting off the oxygen to your brain
@lovemoz1 Ever higher numbers of infections means ever higher probability of a new variant of concern. Covid is not finished with us, even if we pretend we are finished with Covid.

@StuartDNeilson People often hear about % of declining cases/deaths or hospitalizations (same in US) w/out seeing graph over time such as you present. Still high & new VOCs likely. https://t.co/FgmKyj3z5F
